title: Register for Google Earth Engine
text:
Go to https://code.earthengine.google.com/register and Login with your Google Account









Figure 1: Accept the User Agreement and confirm












Figure 2: Click on “Create new project”












Figure 3: Choose a project name (e.g. adls-datalab). Choosing an Organisation is not necessary.












Figure 4: Choose See if you are eligible for non-commercial use












Figure 5: Select Public or private academic institution as the organisation type












Figure 6: Enter ZHAW as the name of the institution, Scientific research as the use and How has the forest in lenk recovered as the research question and Regional as the geographic scope of the project












Figure 7: Choose No to the question on whether you’ve previously published work on this topic












Figure 8: On the question “Will you use Earth Engine for any of the following?” you can choose Scientific reserach as well as Forestry from the drop down












Figure 9: In the popup concerning API, choose Enable












Figure 10: You should now see that your project is registered for non commercial use












Figure 11: Now, you can visit https://code.earthengine.google.com












Figure 12: Here, choose the project you created in the previous steps












Figure 13: Once you see the the welcome popup, you’re done!
